channel.title: Comments on: The Larronde Residence – 237 N. Hope Street

item.title: By: Steve Sichi
item.dc:creator: Steve Sichi
item.description: Very interesting! Â Didnâ€t know anything about the Larronde family. Â I just found my great grandfather Floyd Desseryâ€s Los Angeles High School Spanish textbook. There is a sticker in the front naming John M. Larronde, 237 Hope Street. I am assuming John sold/passed it to my great grandfather, who graduated from LA High in 1898. The Desserys were also French immigrants who lived in Brooklyn Heights (now Boyle Heights.)

item.title: By: Suzanne Murphy Larronde

item.description: Am fascinated to learn more about my mom, Juanitaâ€s family. Es un verdadero placer.

item.title: By: Hannah
item.dc:creator: Hannah
item.description: Enjoyed the informative article! Dominguez Rancho Adobe Museum has in its collection a box of wool from the sheep Pierre Larronde raised on Rancho San Pedro. I came across this post in my research on the object.
item.content:encoded: Enjoyed the informative article! Dominguez Rancho Adobe Museum has in its collection a box of wool from the sheep Pierre Larronde raised on Rancho San Pedro. I came across this post in my research on the object.
